intro: Neuracanthus lindaui, commonly known as the Lindau's neuracladus, is a rare and striking member of the Campanulaceae family. It is characterized by its unique, tubular flowers that range in color from pale blue to violet, often with intricate markings. Native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia, this plant thrives in cool, humid environments with well-drained soil. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in a fine, silvery pubescence. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Neuracanthus lindaui is considered a conservation concern.
